Articles.Content:
I'm with Capt Snuggler, it's the player's skill that should determine the ship's performance. It's the player who gets better with practice.

Exactly... it is the Kerbal's skill. The more experience, the better they get. Just like you... when you started driving a car. A car will ALWAYS handle the same; it is the driver that makes the difference.

It depends. If Jeb's deft controls make the ship spin a little faster, or use less RCS (simulating the ship NOT doing that stupid thing where it spits fuel out of every single jet continuously) then I'm all for it. If Bob can increase your Isp or TWR I'm a bit more leery.

That's a difference of degree rather than nature. A ship's turning ability is determined by the layout of its RCS and reaction wheels; a better pilot can't change the laws of physics.

Exactly... it is the Kerbal's skill. The more experience, the better they get. Just like you... when you started driving a car. A car will ALWAYS handle the same; it is the driver that makes the difference.

I guess what I'm saying is that IMO it's the player's skill that should matter, not whether the kerbal piloting the vessel has enough skill points. The player is the driver, not the kerbal. This is how it is handled in every simulation game I've ever played, whether driving, flying, or other.

Updating the editor is by far the thing I'm most excited about. Can't tell you how many times I've wanted to pull my hair out because a part wouldn't fit just the way I wanted to. Being able to turn off surface attachment alleviated one teeny tiny source of rage, but there's still so much to be done. Like when you're trying to place a part, and it keeps putting the part way off in the background. There's no way to move the part 3-dimensionally. Sounds like that's what you mean by adding translation, and I'm super excited. I also love the idea of being able to switch from radial to mirror symmetry on the fly. It's gonna make building something like the Dream Chaser much easier (build the plane with mirror symmetry, flip it, build the rocket below with radial).

I don't think it will truly be "on the fly", I think there's probably going to be two or three seconds as the VAB switches to SPH mode, so you won't be switching buildings every time you change a part.

Maybe Kerbal Experience will affect science points? That's one of the only applications that doesn't seem "cheaty".

I'm excited for the promotional video for this update. Will we get pictures of Kerbals building space center facilities, and putting nitroglycerin into the concrete?

Very nice to hear about the editor improvements. I have said before that Part Angle Display is perhaps the single best mod that's been released over the last year (at least), and I would love a gizmo system closer to, say, max's or maya's. Translation would also be great, although in both cases configurable snaps will make or break the feature.
Squad would have messed up if there's a significant delay; Editor Extensions handles it near-instantly, and that's presumably doing some sort of hack.

Bravo!!! It never made sense to me that there were two different buildings. Also love what Romfarer and Mu reported. Excellent!! Looking forward to those.

Maxmaps: no need for a mea culpa here. Squad made the right decision to "get it right" rather than "get it published". Your transparency is to be commended. Especially commendable is the rest of the info you laid out for 0.26, instead of Squad's "it's a secret, but you'll be excited". I'm more excited KNOWING what is planned (even if all do not come to fruition) than I am about "it's a secret." "WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re also integrating the related mod Ã¢â‚¬ËœFine PrintÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ to stock" WE HAVE A WINNER.

It's nice that we're getting info again in the DevNotes. the pre-0.25 were long on text and very, VERY short on info. Rowsdower: keep up the good work!

I'm pretty sure what HarvestR meant by "merging the VAB and SPH into one scene.", he meant behind the scenes. They're still probably separate buildings. At least, I hope they are.

Squad would have messed up if there's a significant delay; Editor Extensions handles it near-instantly, and that's presumably doing some sort of hack.

In my opinion, you shouldn't be able to do it instantly, or at the very least it should always stay calibrated vertically in the VAB and horizontally in the SPH. You can't just switch buildings instantly.

Nevertheless, I'll be please however they change it. It would be better than nothing!

Maybe Kerbal Experience will affect science points? That's one of the only applications that doesn't seem "cheaty".

I agree. Maybe smarter and more experienced Kerbals can produce higher science gains. I think that when .25 was being produced they mentioned more famous and experienced Kerbals having higher reputation gains upon recovery.

I'm with Capt Snuggler, it's the player's skill that should determine the ship's performance. It's the player who gets better with practice.

you build your kerbal army to have the same skills as you ! I would take that challenge anyday anytime. The challenge makes the game attractive , not the spoon feeding

YAY! Upgradeable buildings and easier to edit parts! I'm also delighted to hear that the Kerbies will be getting real experience, too. It'll be nice to have a REASON to prefer or not use certain pilots. Please make sure it's nicely mod-able too, so those of us inclined can even add negative traits, if we see fit!
Awesome. Can't wait. SQUAD you guys have really stepped up your game.

It'll be nice to have a REASON to prefer or not use certain pilots.

A reason? Pfft. That's not

the Kerbal Way!
Hypeee!!! Train train

Huh, steamDB updated... CHOO- *SMACK* I mean um, is this just .26 development or is it .25.1 time?

99.9999% sure it's nothing.

<p><p><strong>Felipe (HarvesteR)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> The implications of such a feature are very far-reaching

This means there could be more than two launching sites right?

Looking good, aside from being out of touch with the community. Most of the .26 planned features are not on the top 10 most wanted features. Not that I don't want these features, but it seems like the major things keep getting put off, aerodynamics, more planets, etc.

Get a load of Felipe here with his thumb on the KSP community pulse. Dude, check a census. Part rotation clarity isn't even in the top 10.

I don't read it as simply Ã¢â‚¬Å“part rotation,Ã¢â‚¬Â I read it as Ã¢â‚¬Å“significant editor overhaulÃ¢â‚¬Â with the promise that your ship design is basically limited by your imagination, not by what the editor lets you do (which right now is very, very, very little). If the editor matches the picture Felipe is painting this could be a quantum leap in ship design as it would fundamentally improve the designs you can come up with.

Looking good, aside from being out of touch with the community. Most of the .26 planned features are not on the top 10 most wanted features. Not that I don't want these features, but it seems like the major things keep getting put off, aerodynamics, more planets, etc.

But, to quote the grand plan post "The last big feature missing from career mode," it sounds like this update may mark scope complete, so aerodynamics, planets, etc. (things that already exist, to some degree, unlike building upgrades) will probably come in the next update or possibly one more after that.

Very nice to hear about the editor improvements. I have said before that Part Angle Display is perhaps the single best mod that's been released over the last year (at least), and I would love a gizmo system closer to, say, max's or maya's. Translation would also be great, although in both cases configurable snaps will make or break the feature.

For a gizmo system, I would suggest that we can have three axes with rotating handles at both sides of each axis. One side has 2 bigger handles (ClockWise & CounterClockWise of course) that can rotate the part 90 degrees per click, another side has 2 smaller handles (also CW & CCW) that can rotate the part 5 degrees per click. And I would also welcome some keyboard modifier like SHIFT/CTRL/ALT to do even 1 degree per click tweaking.

their trait will boost a vesselÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s performance in a variety of areas.

Urm, not really sure what I think of this. I don't like the idea of Kerbal XP levels increasing fuel efficiency, or rocket stabilization, or engine ISP...or anything really. Vessel performance should be pretty consistent...

I can MAYBE see Kerbal experience increasing SAS performance...a better pilot has better control of the stick. But if I pull off a really difficult mission I want it to be because I learned more about flight mechanics and rocket design...not because I flew Jeb on a ton of easy missions to grind XP and his performance boost got me through it.

But of course we'll see what Squad has in store...

I like the idea of upgradable buildings. However, does this mean that the initial buildings will be downgraded? For instance, the VAB and SPH will initially have a smaller area to work with and have fewer maximum parts.

I also hope you implement building durability upgrades. That would be incredible. (I think I may have filed a suggestion about that sometime with regards to the strategies. That could integrate nicely with other upgraded aspects of buildings, making the upgrades cheaper or more expensive based on if you want your buildings to withstand unplanned rocket interceptions. After all, who says duct tape and bailing wire aren't proper building materials!)

Edited October 15, 2014 by Ruedii
Additional quip.

I don't think that Kerbal XP will effect the physical characteristics of the rocket, such as TwR and ISP. That would be way to unrealistic. But I am interested to see what exactly squad has come up with...
I'm wondering if Squad is finally implementing that auto-node execute they promised. Kerbal Experience could have a lot to do with that.

That's a difference of degree rather than nature. A ship's turning ability is determined by the layout of its RCS and reaction wheels; a better pilot can't change the laws of physics.

A ship's turning ability is determined by the layout of its RCS and reaction wheels, and by how well the pilot can use them. I do agree with you though, this sort of thing would have to be VERY carefully done.

What I'm talking about here is how for me to get into orbit, it takes about 4700 dV of fuel. Someone a bit better than me could do it in 4600. Some players take nearly 6000. So the pilot of the ship makes a discernible effect on how well something happens. The problem comes when a really good player plays with really leveled up Kerbals, and therefore breaks the laws of physics that you (and I! I promise) are concerned about.

I guess what I'm saying is that IMO it's the player's skill that should matter, not whether the kerbal piloting the vessel has enough skill points. The player is the driver, not the kerbal. This is how it is handled in every simulation game I've ever played, whether driving, flying, or other.

I agree with you, though I'm willing to wait on my judgement and see how they do it.
